nodes.label: DNA
nodes.description: Deoxyribonucleic acid — the double-helix molecule that stores genetic information as a sequence of A, T, G, C nucleotides.

nodes.label: RNA
nodes.description: Ribonucleic acid — single-stranded molecule transcribed from DNA; includes mRNA, tRNA, rRNA, and guide RNAs.

nodes.label: Protein
nodes.description: Polypeptide chains of amino acids folded into functional structures; the molecular machines of the cell.

nodes.label: Transcription
nodes.description: The process by which RNA polymerase reads a DNA template and synthesizes a complementary mRNA strand.

nodes.label: Translation
nodes.description: Ribosomes decode mRNA codons into a sequence of amino acids, building a polypeptide chain.

nodes.label: Promoter
nodes.description: A DNA sequence upstream of a gene where RNA polymerase binds to initiate transcription.

nodes.label: RBS
nodes.description: Ribosome Binding Site (Shine-Dalgarno in prokaryotes) — the mRNA sequence that recruits the ribosome for translation.

nodes.label: Terminator
nodes.description: A DNA/RNA sequence that signals the end of transcription, causing RNA polymerase to release.

nodes.label: Expression Cassette
nodes.description: A modular genetic unit: Promoter + RBS + Coding Sequence + Terminator, designed for reliable gene expression.

nodes.label: Codon Optimization
nodes.description: Redesigning a gene's codon usage to match the tRNA abundances of a target host organism for higher protein yield.

nodes.label: Metabolic Engineering
nodes.description: Redesigning cellular metabolism by adding, removing, or tuning enzyme pathways to produce desired compounds.

nodes.label: Sanger Sequencing
nodes.description: First-generation sequencing using chain-terminating dideoxynucleotides (ddNTPs) and capillary electrophoresis.

nodes.label: Illumina SBS
nodes.description: Short-read sequencing-by-synthesis using reversible fluorescent terminators on flow-cell clusters; dominant NGS platform.

nodes.label: Nanopore Sequencing
nodes.description: Real-time single-molecule sequencing by measuring ionic current changes as DNA passes through a protein nanopore.

nodes.label: PacBio SMRT
nodes.description: Single-molecule real-time sequencing in zero-mode waveguides; produces long reads (10-100 kb) with high consensus accuracy.

nodes.label: PCR
nodes.description: Polymerase Chain Reaction — exponential amplification of a specific DNA fragment using primers and thermocycling.

nodes.label: Spatial Omics
nodes.description: Techniques that combine sequencing with spatial information, preserving tissue architecture (e.g., Visium, MERFISH).

nodes.label: Flow Cell
nodes.description: The glass surface in Illumina sequencers where DNA clusters form and sequencing-by-synthesis occurs.

nodes.label: Phosphoramidite Chemistry
nodes.description: The 4-step chemical cycle (detritylation, coupling, capping, oxidation) used to build DNA oligos one base at a time.

nodes.label: Oligonucleotide
nodes.description: A short single-stranded DNA or RNA molecule, typically 20-200 nt, synthesized chemically for use as primers, probes, or assembly parts.

nodes.label: Gibson Assembly
nodes.description: Isothermal, one-pot assembly of overlapping DNA fragments using exonuclease, polymerase, and ligase.

nodes.label: Chip-Based Synthesis
nodes.description: Massively parallel oligo synthesis on silicon chips (e.g., Twist Bioscience), enabling thousands of oligos per run.

nodes.label: Error Correction
nodes.description: Enzymatic removal of synthesis errors using mismatch-binding proteins (e.g., MutS) before gene assembly.

nodes.label: DNA Data Storage
nodes.description: Encoding digital information (text, images, video) into synthetic DNA sequences for ultra-dense, long-term archival.

nodes.label: Golden Gate Assembly
nodes.description: Type IIS restriction enzyme-based assembly that allows scarless, directional joining of multiple DNA parts in one reaction.

nodes.label: CRISPR-Cas9
nodes.description: A programmable RNA-guided nuclease system that creates double-strand breaks at specific genomic locations for gene editing.

nodes.label: Cas9 Protein
nodes.description: The endonuclease in CRISPR systems that uses a guide RNA to find and cut complementary DNA sequences.

nodes.label: Guide RNA (sgRNA)
nodes.description: A ~100 nt RNA combining crRNA + tracrRNA that directs Cas9 to a specific 20 bp target adjacent to a PAM sequence.

nodes.label: Base Editing
nodes.description: Precise single-nucleotide changes (C-to-T or A-to-G) using a catalytically impaired Cas9 fused to a deaminase enzyme.

nodes.label: Prime Editing
nodes.description: Search-and-replace editing using a Cas9-nickase fused to reverse transcriptase, guided by a pegRNA template.

nodes.label: MAGE
nodes.description: Multiplex Automated Genome Engineering — simultaneous editing of many genomic sites using pools of synthetic oligos.

nodes.label: PASTE
nodes.description: Programmable Addition via Site-specific Targeting Elements — large DNA insertion using CRISPR + serine integrase.

nodes.label: Genomically Recoded Organism
nodes.description: An organism with reassigned codons (e.g., all TAG stop codons replaced), freeing codons for non-standard amino acids.

nodes.label: Codon
nodes.description: A three-nucleotide unit in mRNA that specifies one amino acid (or a stop signal) during translation.

nodes.label: tRNA
nodes.description: Transfer RNA — adapter molecules that carry specific amino acids and recognize mRNA codons via their anticodon loop.

nodes.label: Ribosome
nodes.description: The molecular machine (rRNA + proteins) that reads mRNA and catalyzes peptide bond formation during translation.

nodes.label: Amino Acid
nodes.description: The 20 standard building blocks of proteins, each specified by one or more codons in the genetic code.

nodes.label: Non-Standard Amino Acid
nodes.description: Unnatural amino acids incorporated into proteins via engineered tRNA/synthetase pairs and reassigned codons.

nodes.label: AEGIS
nodes.description: Artificially Expanded Genetic Information System — synthetic nucleotide bases (Z, P, S, B) beyond A/T/G/C.

nodes.label: Genetic Code Table
nodes.description: The mapping of 64 possible codons to 20 amino acids and 3 stop signals; nearly universal across life.

nodes.label: Gel Electrophoresis
nodes.description: A technique that separates DNA fragments by size as they migrate through an agarose or polyacrylamide gel under an electric field.

nodes.label: Restriction Enzyme
nodes.description: Bacterial endonucleases that recognize and cut specific 4-8 bp palindromic DNA sequences, producing defined fragments.

nodes.label: Agarose Gel
nodes.description: A polysaccharide matrix used in gel electrophoresis; pore size depends on concentration (0.5-2%), separating DNA by size.

nodes.label: DNA Ladder
nodes.description: A mixture of DNA fragments of known sizes run alongside samples to calibrate migration distance to fragment length.

nodes.label: Sticky & Blunt Ends
nodes.description: Sticky ends have single-stranded overhangs that can base-pair; blunt ends are flush cuts. Sticky ends ligate more efficiently.

nodes.label: EtBr / SYBR Staining
nodes.description: Fluorescent dyes that intercalate into DNA, allowing visualization of bands under UV or blue light after electrophoresis.
